title: Who proved the most responsible for the rise of the Persian Empire? - Quora

response.answer_text: Mohammad Reza Pahlavi. In order to legitimize his “dynasty” that had no ties to ever being in a position of power, nevermind royalty, he made and spread so many myths about this amazing heaven-like fantasy of a fair and just empire, even some very smart people believe the nonsense to this day. Interestingly, prior to Pahlavis, Iranian lived for over 2500 years without any awareness of such fallacies, to the point that they still refer to the Achamenid’s ceremonial palace in Pasargad as takht-e-jamshid or “Throne Of Jamshid”, a mythical king, and not the throne of Cyrus or Xerxes. But it worked for him for a couple of decades, as talking about something enough and making lies big enough, you eventually become part of the myth and can call yourself “King of Kings”.
